alert.note: Alert for Coos; Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 10:34PM EDT until July 17 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of western Maine, including the following county, Oxford. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll, Coos and Grafton. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1033 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conway, Bethlehem, Lincoln, Ossipee, Franconia, Pinkham Notch, Mount Washington, Tamworth, Sandwich and Carroll.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
